newsitem.title: GERMANY: Large number of EU states to make EMU - EU president.
newsitem.headline: Large number of EU states to make EMU - EU president.

text.p: A large number of European Union nations would qualify for the planned single currency, even against strictly enforced entry criteria, EU President Jacques Santer said on Tuesday in a German radio interview.

"I am very confident that we can enter the third stage of monetary union on January 1, 1999," he told DeutschlandRadio Berlin, adding that the timetable and criteria for European monetary union (EMU) were "realistic."

The requirements -- that participating nations states bring public deficits and debt down to three percent and 60 percent of gross domestic product this year -- should be laid out restrictively, Santer said.
"There will be no weakening with me," he said.
